task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 346°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent (base to roofline) of the main building ahead, so I will tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
I should now tilt down to include the building’s base and roof in one view so I can approximate total height from ground to roofline.
With the building centered and its base-to-roof span visible, I can give a height estimate based on it appearing roughly a 3‑story structure (≈3.5 m per story plus roof/parapet).
